name: palm date production | palm date | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/14854/documentation

This dataset represent the production of 1 kg of palm dates (fresh matter). The yield is  8484kg/ha. The average of palm trees per hectare is 100 (thus we count 84.84 kg of palm dates per tree). The lifetime of a palm tree is estimated at 80 years, during which the first 5 years the palm tree grows but does not produce fruit. This data takes into account these 5 first years. The production of palm date are mainly manual and does not require machineries.

This activity starts when planting palm trees in the field.The production of the cutting is not considered. All processes of the agricultural production are included, such as the ressources used for the fruit growth. 

The dataset includs all the operations for the production of the fruits during one year. It includes Soil cultivation, fertilising, harvesting, irrigating. This activity ends when the fruit is harvested and transported to a storage facility (10 km from the field).
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/012:Growing of perennial crops/0122:Growing of tropical and subtropical fruits

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The datas have been collected for year 2012
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset is an extrapolation that refers to an average production in south Tunisia - Chott Djerid  - Tozeur
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset is an original dataset  specific to the production of palm date in the south of Tunisia (Region of Chott-Djerid)
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data were compiled from informations provided by farmers in the region of Tozeur, Tunisia. The datas were verified and adjusted by experts in palm date. As the production of palm date occurs in an arid regions, no emission to water are included (leaching of NO3, PO4, heavy metals , soil erosion, etc.).

flow.name: palm date
flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/012:Growing of perennial crops/0122:Growing of tropical and subtropical fruits

exchanges.description: 3 kg per tree is used each year

exchanges.description: The dry matter content is .79114, the C content on a dry matter basis 0.251, 0.79114*0.251=0.1986 kg C/kg dates harvested. This value has to be multiplied by the yield and converted to CO2: 0.1986*44/12=6177.3 kg CO2. This amount of CO2 is taken up from the air and converted to the product.

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'palm date' is calculated to be circa 3.54E-02 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 7.07E-02 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.
